titleStmt.title: Martin Fulks et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9464

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To his excellency the govenor of kuntucky

your petition would requst that you wold remit as much of a forfeiture Bail Bond as may Bee Going to the Commonwealth upon which Judgment was renderd at the las April turm of the Hart circuit cort Aganst Henry M. Thorp,, John,, L,, Thorp Clayton,, C,, Thorp

Martin fulks
Jas Brashear
Thos J Upton
William,, S, Wells
D. P. Walling
James R Gibson
M. Ettlinger
Johnson Prenell
Tabbirt,, Gaddie
A, H, Srygley
James Butler
Handin Butler
J, C, Logsdon
P H Buckner
W Craddock
John Robertson
William Grubb
James Pucket
Richard Pucket
J, B, Jaggers
S T Drury
S H Sullivan
martin, W,, Hages
Joseph ,,C,, Logsdon
W J Logsdon
George ,W, Logsdon
John H King
J. H. Amos
A G Gardner
Thomas Pucket
L. Hawkins
D. W. Whitman
Gabriel, Reynolds
W Lawson
Wm D Richardson
J W Fitzpatrick
W, L, Lester
W B Craddock
Names
A V Enlow
Write to John Donan & get the amount & when rendered
